result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Richard Edward Poppen

1:53 PM Prosecuting attorney Erica Ellenwood in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Richard Edward Poppen not in court. Set for RW/INIT. ADA Ellenwood requests warrant. Court reviews letter filed by DE today. Based upon Defendant's second non-appearance, Court issues body only warrant adjoining states. Adjourned at 1:55 PM.  gll
from DE requesting a new court date. Reviewed by SJN.  gll

1:19 PM CO: SJN, RPR: Deiss, Clerk: Lindabaur. ADA: Erica Ellenwood with Student Intern Ali Casey  DF ATTY:  Jeremiah Harrelson for today Defendant Richard Edward Poppen not in court. Set for INIT. Court reviews letter filed by DE requesting to a new court date. ADA Ellenwood responds and requests a warrant. Atty Harrelson responds. Court issues warrant and STAYS until Friday 7/29/22 at 1:05 PM. Adjourned at 1:21 PM.  gll

12:39 p.m. p/c from DE stating he can't get to court today.  I advised him the court needs something in writing and gave fax #.
DE called to state he does not have a way to get to court today. Clerk advised we need something in writing, but given that the court date is in 20 minutes, transferred call to JA. srb
